"Kure" in Japan Encyclopedia, p. 577. == History == In 1894, Prime Minister Itō Hirobumi transfered the Imperial Headquarters (Daihon'ei) to Kure.Endoh, Taoke. (2009). Exporting Japan: Politics of Emigration to Latin America, p. 220 n31. The modern city of Kure was founded in 1902. The natural harbor was a naval base until the end of the Second World War. The Japanese battleship Yamato was built at Kure. "Yamato (Battleship, 1941-1945)" at History.navy.mil . Retrieved 2013-2-26. ===Timeline=== * 1889: Kure Army base established * 1894: Imperial Diet met at Kure * 1902: City of Kure created from merger of Washō, Futagawa, Miyahara and Sōyamada * 1903: Kure Naval Arsenal established. ==Education== * Goko Academy ==References== ==Other websites== * http://www.city.kure.lg.jp/english/index.html ; * Yamato Museum * Category:Cities in Hiroshima Prefecture
